Button and submit inputs

Button inputs are useful as triggers for reactive or observer expressions. The reactive value of a button input is the number of times it has been clicked.

A submit input is a special type of button used to control HTML form submission. Unlike shiny’s submitButton, yonder’s submit inputs will not freeze all reactive inputs on the page.

Arguments

id

A character string specifying the id of the button or link input.

label

A character string specifying the label text on the button input.

block

If TRUE, the input is block-level instead of inline, defaults to FALSE. A block-level element will occupy the entire width of its parent element.

text

A character string specifying the text displayed as part of the link input.

...

Additional named arguments passed as HTML attributes to the parent element.

Simple vs block button

Block buttons will fill the width of their parent element

A submit button

Possible colors
